what: Generate a file with formatted code — render_code
title: Generate a file with formatted code — render_code
text: Format piece code copy email, pdf, document, etc.

title: Generate a file with formatted code — render_code
code: render_code(   output = "word",   browser = getOption("browser"),   eval = FALSE,   font_size = 12,   code = TRUE )

title: Generate a file with formatted code — render_code
text: output string. output format ("pdf", "html" "word" accepted) browser string. path browser open generated file format eval boolean specifying code evaluated font_size numeric. font size pdf format. code boolean. copied content

title: Generate a file with formatted code — render_code
Generate a file with formatted code — render_code
text: function allows user generate formatted code (email, document, copy, message, etc.) fly. accepts mainly word, pdf html formats, format accepted rmarkdown computer. use function, simply copy piece code run render_code() arguments interest us. want content R code, use code argument FALSE. want R code evaluated (result displayed), can use argument eval TRUE. pdf format, can change font size using font_size argument. Finally, can change browser opens file default browser argument.

title: Generate a file with formatted code — render_code
code: # \donttest{ # Copy a snippet of code clipr::write_clip("plot(AirPassengers)", allow_non_interactive = TRUE) #> Error: Clipboard on X11 requires 'xclip' (recommended) or 'xsel'; Clipboard on Wayland requires 'wl-copy' and 'wl-paste'.  render_code(     output = "word" ) #> Error: Clipboard on X11 requires 'xclip' (recommended) or 'xsel'; Clipboard on Wayland requires 'wl-copy' and 'wl-paste'.  render_code(     output = "html",     eval = FALSE ) #> Error: Clipboard on X11 requires 'xclip' (recommended) or 'xsel'; Clipboard on Wayland requires 'wl-copy' and 'wl-paste'.  render_code(     output = "pdf",     eval = TRUE,     font_size = 16 ) #> Error: Clipboard on X11 requires 'xclip' (recommended) or 'xsel'; Clipboard on Wayland requires 'wl-copy' and 'wl-paste'. # }
